text: Malawimonada (order Malawimonadida) is a phylum of microorganisms. They occupy a basal position in the evolutionary tree of eukaryotes. ==Description== Malawimonada is a group of biflagellate, free-living protozoans in freshwater or soil. ==Phylogeny== The malawimonads are similar to ancyromonads. (The diagram below, starts on the left side.) There is no consensus about where Metamonada belongs (or should be) on the diagram. ==Related pages== *Eukaryota, the much larger group in which this group is contained. ==Other websites== Category:Eukaryotes
title: Malawimonad
